name: Short Permutation Problem
statement: Xomu - Last Dance â € You are given an integer $$$n$$$. For each $$$(m, k)$$$ such that $$$3 \leq m \leq n+1$$$ and $$$0 \leq k \leq n-1$$$, count the permutations of $$$[1, 2, ..., n]$$$ such that $$$p_i + p_{i+1} \geq m$$$ for exactly $$$k$$$ indices $$$i$$$, modulo $$$998\,244\,353$$$.
inputFormat: The input consists of a single line, which contains two integers $$$n$$$, $$$x$$$ ($$$2 \leq n \leq 4000$$$, $$$1 \leq x < 1\,000\,000\,007$$$).
outputFormat: Let $$$a_{m,k}$$$ be the answer for the pair $$$(m, k)$$$, modulo $$$998\,244\,353$$$. Let $$$$$$\large S = \sum_{m=3}^{n+1} \sum_{k=0}^{n-1} a_{m,k}x^{mn+k}\phantom{0}.$$$$$$ Output a single line with an integer: $$$S$$$ modulo $$$1\,000\,000\,007$$$. Note that using two different modulos is intentional. We want you to calculate all the $$$a_{m,k}$$$ modulo $$$998\,244\,353$$$, then treat them like integers in the range $$$[0, 998\,244\,352]$$$, and hash them modulo $$$1\,000\,000\,007$$$.
